IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: Umbilical Cord Derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells Transplantation for Active and Refractory Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
IdentificationModule.OfficialTitle: Phase I/II: Umbilical Cord Derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells Transplantation For Active And Refractory Systemic Lupus Erythematosus

ResponsibleParty.ResponsiblePartyInvestigatorAffiliation: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

LeadSponsor.LeadSponsorName: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: This study will explore safety and efficacy of allogeneic umbilical cord (UC) derived mesenchymal stem cells transplantation (MSCT) to treat patients with active and refractory systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) who have been resistant to multiple standard treatments. The underlying hypothesis is that the active SLE condition is caused by an abnormal immune homeostasis that can be restored by MSCT.

ArmGroup.ArmGroupDescription: human umbilical cord derived MSC transplantation for SLE

ArmGroupInterventionName: Biological: human umbilical cord derived MSC transplantation for SLE

Intervention.InterventionName: human umbilical cord derived MSC transplantation for SLE

InterventionOtherName: Allogenic MSC derived from umbilical cord

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeMeasure: British Isles Lupus Assessment Group score (BILAG)

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Lupus serology (Alb, ANA, dsDNA, C3, C4)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: pre-MSC transplantation, 1, 3, 6 and 12 months post MSC transplantation

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Renal function (GFR, Blood Urea Nitrogen, urinalysis)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: pre-MSC transplantation, 1, 3, 6 and 12 months post MSC transplantation (for GFR assessed at baseline and 12 months after MSCT)
